availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Lawrence Sage (Frankfort, Kentucky, gas fitter)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, gunsmith, and gas fitter. Connecticut native. Son of Charles Sage and Julia Ann Sage. Gunsmith in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Gas fitter in Frankfort in 1860. Super intendant of gasworks in Frankfort in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 32A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 274.
The Barbour Collection of Connecticut Town Vital RecordsEd. Lorraine Cook White, Vol. 6, Chatham County Vital Records (1767-1854), 1994.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Franklin County, KY, July 1863, p. 24.
"James L. Sage (1820-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial 70454363, accessed January 4, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70454363.
